title: Design and Implementation Strategies for Mathematics MOOCs Suitable for Indonesian Learning Culture

context.prior_knowledge: Requires intermediate-level mathematical theory background (equations, functions, statistics) and hands-on experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Analysis of Indonesia’s educational system and learner characteristics (basic computational skills, preference for problem-solving approaches) to apply MOOCs in mathematics, including strategies for mathematical notation in Bahasa Indonesia

learning_goals: Evaluation of the suitability of math MOOCs within Indonesia’s national education system, focusing on formula-based and problem-solving approaches.
Explanation of methods to analyze self-directed learning potential for math concept comprehension in digital environments through graph analysis and proof case studies.
Proposal of MOOC content design strategies tailored to math subject characteristics (e.g., equations, statistics, geometry).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
